paper_abstract: Though innovation is a popular theme of US literature, its specific meaning for libraries remains obscure. Clarifying the implicit definition of innovation in librarianship can facilitate a more meaningful use of the term. To do so, we employ a ground-up exploration of innovation through the white literature in conjunction with a detailed survey of website features, of 160 libraries across the United States and Canada.
paper_title: Innovation in Public and Academic North American Libraries: Examining White Literature and Website Applications
